item.title: Remove Duplicates From Sorted List II
item.description: Given a sorted linked list, delete all nodes that have duplicate numbers, leaving only distinct numbers from the original list. Example 1: Input: 1->2->3->3->4->4->5 Output: 1->2->5 Example 2: Input: 1->1->1->2->3 Output: 2->3

item.title: Remove Linked List Elements
item.description: Remove all elements from a linked list of integers that have value val. Example: Input: 1->2->6->3->4->5->6, val = 6 Output: 1->2->3->4->5 Solution: # Definition for singly-linked list. # class ListNode: # def __init__(self, x): # self.val = x # self.next = None class Solution: def removeElements(self, head, val): """ :type head: ListNode :type val: int :rtype: ListNode """ pre = ListNode(0) pre.next = head pos = pre while pos.next !

item.title: 15. 3sum
item.description: Given an array nums of n integers, are there elements a, b, c in nums such that a + b + c = 0? Find all unique triplets in the array which gives the sum of zero. Note: The solution set must not contain duplicate triplets. Example: Given array nums = [-1, 0, 1, 2, -1, -4], A solution set is: [ [-1, 0, 1], [-1, -1, 2] ] Solution:

item.title: 80. Remove Duplicates From Sorted Array II
item.description: Given a sorted array nums, remove the duplicates in-place such that duplicates appeared at most twice and return the new length. Do not allocate extra space for another array, you must do this by modifying the input array in-place with O(1) extra memory. Example 1: Given nums = [1,1,1,2,2,3], Your function should return length = 5, with the first five elements of nums being 1, 1, 2, 2 and 3 respectively.

item.title: Remove Duplicates From Sorted Array
item.description: Given a sorted array nums, remove the duplicates in-place such that each element appear only once and return the new length. Do not allocate extra space for another array, you must do this by modifying the input array in-place with O(1) extra memory. Example 1: Given nums = [1,1,2], Your function should return length = 2, with the first two elements of nums being 1 and 2 respectively. It doesn't matter what you leave beyond the returned length.
